seg.desc: Quite uniform handwriting, characterized by rounded letters, with broad and thick shapes. From to (text 4) the hand looks slightly different, less careful and in a smaller size. Peculiar and ancient features: the upper horizontal strokes of መ, ሠ, በ are slanted to the left; መ has sometimes angular loops; ዐ and ፬ have a triangular shape, downwards oriented; the loop of ሎ is attached to the body of the letter; ጵ has the 6th order marker set up on the vertical stroke at the top, oriented to the left (e.g. , ); ፪ has sometimes the loops attached; a few times it is with the bottom loop open (e.g. , ); መ and ሙ have sometimes the right loop detached from the ruled line (e.g. l. 2, l. 3); ፮ is with the loop open, looking like 'compressed' ፯ (e.g. ); marginal cues (numerals) for rubrication (e.g. , ).
